reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We heard about Courtney's from a couple who spend time here during the summer months and have only stayed in their cottages. My husband and I were in unit 18-it was just okay-When we first got there it was nighttime and was a little creepy-They knew we were coming in late, but didn't bother to leave the light on-so we had a bit of difficulty finding our unit. The next day we heard the cleaning folks working behind our unit-it seems that the washing machine is in a shed behind our room. It was a bit noisy in the afternoon-We like to take afternoon naps, but it wasn't possible here. The hispanic woman at the office in the mornings was not polite at all-she was bothered when we showed up 15 minutes too early for coffee-she had a male friend who was there with her who was smoking in the kitchen area-Not impressed with her at all! The room seemed pretty clean-the shower head was terrible and hardly had any water pressure at all-but at least we had a shower. The windows in the bedroom were made of plexiglass and they had gaps in them that would allow in the bugs- There wasn't any room to put our luggage in this unit-very small-but we were told this at the time of our reservation. Overall okay-we've stayed in worse and we've stayed in a whole lot better! We looked at another unit and are definately considering visiting again-just in another room. The location was great! Nice neighborhood-at first the alley was a little creepy, but was okay and we felt more comfortable the longer we stayed. We'll go back, just not in #18. It's worth another try!
reviews.title: It was just okay-

likes.disliked: — Needed to be updated and more comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about Courtney's Place! We have stayed there twice, once in May in one of the private rooms and again in November in one of the private cottages. I recommend a private cottage if you are a couple who prefer peace & solitude. I agree with previous reviewers that the sheets don't stay on the bed, but you can get these straps at linen stores that hold the sheets on. Our cottage even had central air & heat (which came in handy since there was a cold front and temp in Key West dipped into the 40s & 50s overnight). The breakfast is very basic, but at their prices, that is fine. We took our dog, who is 1 yr old, and he was more than wlecome. I highly recommend this place!
reviews.title: Love Courtney's Place!

likes.disliked: — water pressure not strong in shower

reviews.text: Our stay in Cottage 17 for 4 nights was very comfortable; very nice. We travelled with a medium size dog. Courtney's is very pet friendly (however our dog was freaked by the number of cats around Key West and how surly the cats could be. I even got clawed by one when it tried to attack my dog!). Nikki, in the front office, was always very friendly and helpful with suggestions. Breakfast was always plentiful, good, and fun to chat with others. Staff was considerate about not entering when dog was present in the cottage (we just left a sign letting them know whether we needed service or not). As mentioned by others, the sheets didn't fit the king bed. However, that's because the mattress was extra thick and the best bed I've ever slept on in a hotel/motel. C17 has it's own parking spot so no problems with parking (except when maint. workers parked there once). The kitchen was great and sufficiently stocked with supplies. We walked everywhere since you're a couple of blocks to central Duval Street in one direction and convenience mart/dog walking park in the other. FYI, dogs can swim at "Dog Beach"- about 50 ft wide but better than nothing at all (ask staff for directions).
reviews.title: Great for pets
disappointment
reviews.text: My husband and I have spent several vacations in Key West, and each time we have stayed at different locations. Our last experience was, by far the worst - Courtney's Place.

We were taking an extended family vacation and decided on Courtney's because we had two young children (ages 7 and 8) as well as our dogs and this seemed to be the place to go... While it worked out well with the children and animals - there were several disappointments...
reviews.title: Great Location and Nice Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had cottage #9 and truly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and came with an attached patio with fridge, coffee grinder/maker, and blender. Courtney's Inn made us feel welcome and we felt like being at home. The pool was relaxing, the breakfast delicious, and the location perfect!
reviews.title: Cozy Oasis near Duval St

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a week in cottage # 17. This was not my first visit at Courtney's Place. I stayed in cottage #1 a few years ago...thus my disappointment.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: The cottage had three televisions...but no remote control in the second bedroom, and the other two had no batteries. The linens were so thin and worn you could practically see thru them. The pillows needed replaced along with the comforters. The front porch was filthy along with the plastic chairs and table.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.text: The day before we arrived a storm went thru so the pool was murky but we were assured by 'Nikki" that the pool man would be coming that day. This was on Monday. When we left on Friday he had still not come and the pool was disgusting.
reviews.title: Like family!!!!!

likes.liked: — Great value and they make you feel like family
likes.disliked: — It does not have an ocean view

reviews.title: Wonderful stay
reviews.text: I booked with Courtney's a second time because my first experience was so wonderful but it's obvious to me they have let the property slide.

reviews.title: Different POV
reviews.text: We were disappointed with our stay. We were in room 5 at Courtney's Place Too. On the internet an extended breakfast was advertised. It consisted of toast and wafles that could be heated in a toaster or microwave, packaged snacks and hard boiled eggs with cofee, juice, and water. There was also cereal, yogurt and fruit cups. We weren't told that the breakfast was at the main building "Courtney's Place" several blocks away. We also weren't thrilled to find a cat sleeping on one of the breakfast tables and didn't go back after the first morning.

reviews.title: Never again!
reviews.text: The confirmation that we printed out did not include directions and the place we stopped at wasn't familar with the street address. We had to call for directions and again the next morning to get directions as to where breakfast was located at.

reviews.title: Everything you hear is true
reviews.text: In addition, parking was terrible and it was difficult finding a space near our room or at the main building when we went there for breakfast.

We would not recommend room 5, if you're over 5 feet tall. The room was originally an attic and we kept bumping our heads on the ceiling. My husband is over 6 feet and had limited room to walk without ducking. The toilet was next to the window AC and at 5'2" my left knee barely had room to clear it. Oh, and watch the toilet seat. You need a seat belt!
reviews.title: Comfortable and accomodating
Don't stay at C-19, otherwise a great place to stay
reviews.text: I know they can't control or screen the people staying there, but I didn't appreciate the woman in the pool giving our 13 year old a 'show'. She saw him looking out the window at the pool, pointed up at him, and took off her bikini top and tossed it to her husband. Thankfully, she turned her back to him prior to taking it off. The tables were turned when someone walked into the pool area unexpectedly and her husband tossed her top back to her.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is terribly overdue since we stayed at Courtney's Place last year, but I felt we owed it to travelers to post one since this site has been so good to us!
reviews.title: Quaint and very Key West

likes.liked: — How cute and quaint it was

reviews.text: Courtney's place is very Key West. My fiance and I are not the type of people who travel 5-star. We like to get a taste of what the community has to offer. Sure, you could spend large amounts of $$ to stay in a chain hotel and get cleaner edges to the details, but that is not what Key West is about to us. We are Floridians, but we come to Key West to be a part of a slower, laid-back lifestyle and Courtney's Place was the perfect environment. It is very affordable. The bed was super comfortable. Yes, the sheets came off the bed, but who cares when you are sunk into the most comfortable bed ever after a walk through downtown. The cottages are very quaint and surrounded with lush beautiful, tropical greenery.
reviews.title: Pleased with Courtney's Place
Cigar-makers Cottage C16 was perfect for us!
reviews.text: Parking is tight, but as soon as you get out of your car to walk around to the entrance you are on one of the famous little key west corridors that make its little villages so interesting. Duval was within walking distance (maybe 10 minutes). Definitely do not stay here if you want someone at your beck and call or if you want to have fancy accomomadations. This is about the real experience as well as budget traveling. We felt embedded into the lifestyle rather than merely observing it.

reviews.title: Cute Courtney's Cottages
reviews.text: We just spent a week at Courtney's Place in Key West. We were there for our daughter's wedding at the Ocean Key's Resort. Courtney and her staff were always so friendly and helpful it made you feel like you were with friends. The wedding party rented six units in all and everyone was extremely happy with their stay. The courtyard served as a quaint meeting place for everyone and was a place to relax away from the action of Duvall street which was only a couple of blocks away. This place could not have fit what we were looking for any better. I would recommend Courtney's place to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the folks with us to Key West. We are all used to "basic" accomodations when we travel; nothing too fancy or expensive. Courtney's Place was actually nicer than we expected, given the great price for our stay ($229/night for the 4 of us!). C16 is an old cigar-makers cottage, historic feeling, with a little front yard, big porch, white picket fence and gate, one bedroom in front and one in back.
reviews.title: loved it
